Utterance: <synch>
Hi, welcome back! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Oh, hi! I've been okay, I guess. Still dealing with the thyroid issue, but I’m trying to manage it.
That sounds challenging. Have you been able to see a doctor about it?
Yes, I had an appointment last week. They adjusted my medication, so I’m hoping that helps.
I hope so too. How has your energy been since then?
It’s been a bit better, but still not where I want it to be. I think the weather is still affecting me too.
That makes sense. You mentioned the grey weather impacting your mood. Have you tried any strategies to cope with that?
I’ve been trying to get outside more when the sun does come out. Even just for a short walk helps.
That’s a great start! How does being outside make you feel?
It definitely lifts my spirits a bit. I feel more energized and less sluggish.
That’s wonderful to hear! Have you been able to keep up with your walking routine?
Not as much as I’d like. I’ve been a bit lazy since the weather's been so dreary.
It’s understandable. Sometimes it can be hard to stay motivated. What do you think might help you get back into that routine?
Maybe setting a specific time each day to walk could help. I need to make it a priority.
That sounds like a good plan. How about we set a small goal for this week? Perhaps aim for walking at least three times?
Yes, that sounds manageable. I think I can do that!
Great! And how about your sleep? Have you noticed any changes since our last session?
A little. I’m still waking up at night, but I’ve been trying to relax more before bed.
That’s a positive step. Have you tried any specific relaxation techniques?
I’ve been listening to calming music and doing some light reading before bed.
Those are excellent strategies. Have you noticed any improvement in your sleep quality?
A little bit, but I still feel tired during the day.
It might take some time to adjust. Have you thought about keeping a sleep diary to track your patterns?
I haven’t, but that could be helpful to see if there are any patterns.
Yes, it could provide insight into what might be affecting your sleep. Would you like to try that?
Sure, I can start that this week.
Perfect! Now, let's shift gears a bit. You mentioned wanting to lose weight last time. Have you thought about any steps you can take toward that goal?
I’ve thought about it, but it’s hard to resist temptation, especially with all the food options around.
It can be tough. What do you think might help you make healthier choices?
Maybe meal prepping could be a good idea. That way, I have healthy options ready.
Meal prepping is a fantastic strategy! It can save time and help you stick to your goals. Would you like to set a goal for that as well?
Yes, I’d like to try that! Maybe I can start with prepping for two days a week.
That sounds realistic. How do you feel about the idea of incorporating more fruits and vegetables into your meals?
I love fruits! Vegetables, on the other hand, I struggle with a bit.
That’s completely normal. How about trying to incorporate one new vegetable each week?
I could do that! It might help me discover some new favorites.
Exactly! It’s all about exploring and finding what you enjoy. Let’s check in on that next time.
Sounds good!
Before we wrap up, how has your relationship with your family been lately?
It’s been okay. I’ve been trying to reach out more to my brother. We had a nice chat last week.
That’s great to hear! Strengthening those connections can be really beneficial for your mood.
Yes, it felt good to catch up. I miss those conversations.
Building those relationships can provide support. Are there any other family members you’d like to reconnect with?
I think I might reach out to my sister too. We haven’t talked in a while.
That sounds like a wonderful idea. It could help you feel more connected.
I’ll definitely try to do that.
Excellent! So, to recap, your goals for this week are to walk three times, keep a sleep diary, and meal prep for two days. How does that sound?
That sounds manageable and I’m excited to try it all!
I’m glad to hear that! I look forward to hearing how it goes in our next session. Take care!
Thank you! I’ll see you next time.
Goodbye!
